findings.title: Failing test case for updateDiscountMultiplier() function.
findings.description: The test case at Line 121 in SIGHBoosters_test.py expects a revert when a zero value is set as the _platformFeeDiscount. However, no logic is present in the smart contract to revert the transaction on zero as input.

findings.title: Incorrect require statement in getTokenBalance()
findings.description: The require statement present in getTokenBalance() function checks the validity of tokenAcceptedAsPayment variable instead of token address variable.

findings.title: Redundant check in safeTransferFrom() function.
findings.description: The safeTransferFrom() function contains a redundant require statement which is again repeated and checked at another location.

findings.title: Spelling mistake in the developer’s comment
The onERC721Received() function is open for anyone to call anytime.
findings.description: The onERC721Received() function of SIGHBoostersSale contract can be called by anyone with any tokenId as input, preventing the actual owner of a specific tokenId from depositing his Sigh Booster in SIGHBoostersSale contract for sale.
